docs.lead_paragraph: Gasoline prices are surging again, but if drivers stop at a Burger King along the way, at least some of the food they eat will be from suppliers that treat their animals well.

headline.main: Summer’s Here, at Least at the Gas Pump
headline.print_headline: Summer’s Here, at Least at the Gas Pump

docs.snippet: Gasoline prices are surging again, but if drivers stop at a Burger King along the way, at least some of the food they eat will be from suppliers that treat their animals well.

docs.lead_paragraph: In announcing strict new animal welfare guidelines, Burger King this week put suppliers on notice that they must change their animal agriculture practices if they want to continue doing business with the company. Burger King, the world's second-largest hamburger chain, behind McDonald's, set goals that were relatively modest, 2 percent of its eggs must come from cage-free hens and 10 percent of its pork from suppliers that do not use crates for sows during pregnancy. But the chain, which is based in Miami, said it would continue to increase its purchases as more competitively priced supplies become available.

docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Eric Keroack, the head of the federal agency responsible for providing women with access to contraceptives and pregnancy counseling, resigned.
docs.snippet: Dr. Eric Keroack, the head of the federal agency responsible for providing women with access to contraceptives and pregnancy counseling, resigned.

docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Eric Keroack, the head of the federal agency responsible for providing women with access to contraceptives and pregnancy counseling, resigned after Medicaid officials took action against him in Massachusetts. The Health and Human Services Department provided no details about the action. Dr. Keroack was chosen five months ago by President Bush to oversee the department's Office of Population Affairs and its $283 million annual budget. His selection angered abortion rights groups because he had worked for an organization that opposes contraception. Massachusetts Medicaid officials did not return calls for comment.

headline.main: National Briefing | Washington: Health Official Resigns

docs.abstract: Dr Eric Keroack, head of Health and Human Services Department responsible for providing women with access to contraceptives and pregnancy counseling, resigns after Medicaid officials take action against him in Massachusetts (S)

docs.lead_paragraph: Some doctors and researchers say that in a few years the use of stem cells could grow new knee ligaments or elbow tendons, creating a therapy that becomes the vanguard of sports injury repair.

docs.lead_paragraph: Thousands took to Warsaw’s streets to demand a complete ban on abortion, including in cases of rape or incest.
